Case reference: 2014005727.CaseDesc: Ryan Slobodzian was last seen when he was dropped off on Henry Avenue. Mr. Slobodzian has not been located and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Backpack: Unknown, May have been carrying at time of disappearance

Case reference: 2014005155.CaseDesc: Harold Murray Harvey was seen for the last time by a neighbour in front of his residence in Pincourt on September 14, 2008. Mr. Harvey was reported missing by a family member on September 19, 2008. At the time of his disappearance he was taking medication, which he left behind. Mr. Harvey had left his home a few times in the past but always returned after a couple of days.

Case reference: 2014003849.CaseDesc: On September 16, 1998, Jocelyne Boardman was seen for the last time when she left a friend's residence in the Verdun District in Montreal, Quebec, to return to her home in Kingston, Ontario. Jocelyne is known to only wear black clothing and she hasn't been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001487.CaseDesc: On July 21, 1995, Raymond Snakeskin was last seen in Wollaston Lake, SK. He had told another individual that he was making a pilgrimage to Zangeza Bay on Reindeer Lake, approximately 60 kilometers through the bush. Mr. Snakeskin has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001314.CaseDesc: On May 2, 1981, Verna Bjerky was seen for the last time hitchhiking from Hope to Kamloops, British Columbia. She was carrying roller skates over her shoulder and was seen getting into a vehicle with a lone occupant. Verna has not been seen or heard from since.

Hair: Blonde, Long, Long blonde hair with short bangs
Shoes: Canvas, Brown, "North Star" Brand, running shoes
Shirt: Red, White, Red with white flowers

Case reference: 2012020175.CaseDesc: This adult male was recovered from the south arm of the Fraser River off No. 4 and Garden City Road.

Teeth: Visible Missing, No dental work done; all molars missing
Socks: Wool, Grey, work type wool socks

Case reference: 2016061964.CaseDesc: On December 26, 1976, an unidentified Caucasian man, believed to be between the ages of 55 to 60 years old, was found in an abandoned blue van near 21 Blackburn Avenue, Toronto. He was malnourished, very dirty and heavily infested with lice. Locals knew him to live under the bridge at the foot of Blackburn Ave for about 15 years and he was known to local children as old Billy. He was circumcised. His feet showed frostbite which had become infected.

Hair: Grey, Long, Frontal balding and a grey beard 3 inches long
Teeth: Visible Missing, He had a few scattered carious teeth

Case reference: 2016065650.CaseDesc: On December 29, 2008, the skeletal remains of a male was recovered from the Lower Niagara River near the Maid of the Mist Docks below Niagara Falls. No clothing or personal effects were recovered. These remains may have been in the water for many years.

Case reference: 2014004857.CaseDesc: On September 21, 1992, David Neufeld, Peter Bentzen and Kenneth Vaughan were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. The three men had been associating with each other as “runners” in order to smuggle cigarettes into Canada from the United States by means of a boat. David’s vehicle and boat trailer were located at Ashbridges Bay, Toronto. The aging boat that was borrowed from a friend has never been recovered and the three men have not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014004211.CaseDesc: On August 24, 1987, Louis Haineault, 48 years old, was last seen heading out in a boat to fish on Cree Lake, north of Buffalo Narrows, SK. Searchers located his boat and fishing nets, however the boat was inoperable. Searches of the area failed to locate Mr. Haineault.

Case reference: 2014002751.CaseDesc: Rebecca Guno was last seen in June of 1983 by her common law husband. Miss Guno was taking a bus downtown with an unknown female friend, but did not arrive at her intended destination.

Case reference: 2006018899.CaseDesc: William Bowman was last seen leaving his hunting camp, 83 kilometres north of the Town of Massey, Ontario, at the north end of Hwy.# 810, District Algoma, Monestine Township on October 15, 1979.

Case reference: 2014003491.CaseDesc: On June 12th, 1981, Gordon Westover was seen at a local beer garden in Fort St John, BC at approximately 11:00 PM. Mr. Westover left the gathering in an unknown direction and has not been seen or heard from since. Mr. Westover has a mild mental disability and has been known to impersonate professional people such as police, firefighters, military and doctors. Mr. Westover told several people at the party that he was going to join the military, but no records show Mr. Westover was ever recruited. Mr. Westover has not been seen or heard from.

Case reference: 2011001499.CaseDesc: At the time of his disappearance, Luke Joly-Durocher was visiting friends in North Bay, Ontario. He resides in Temiskaming, Quebec. Video surveillance showed Luke being refused entry into Cecil's Eatery and Beer Society at approximately 11:54 p.m. He left by himself and has not been seen or heard from since that time.

Shirt: Grey, T-shirt, may have had a small purple animal logo on the bottom corner
Belt: Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Black, Studded belt, black on the front and purple around the waist
Deformity: Right Forearm, Thinner than left forearm

Case reference: 2014002831.CaseDesc: On December 26, 1980, Zulfiqar Charania was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. During the time of his disappearance, Zulfiqar lived in Ottawa but was at his sister’s home in Montreal to spend the holidays. When Zulfiqar left Montreal he did so without his suitcase, which was filled with his personal belongings. Zulfiqar had indicated that he intended on travelling to New York in the United States to visit another family member.

Case reference: 2014006142.CaseDesc: On May 23, 2013, at approximately 6:30 a.m., John Lioudakis was seen for the last time at the Toronto Pearson International Airport, in Toronto, Ontario. John flew to Mexico and was scheduled to return on May 31, 2013, but he never boarded the flight.

Tattoo: Left Ankle, On calf; unknown animal

Case reference: 2016024223.CaseDesc: Joseph Amiro was last seen leaving the Queen Elizabeth II Health Sciences Centre in Halifax, Nova Scotia on May 1, 2016.  Mr. Amiro suffers from medical issues that require daily medication. He is known to wear glasses and walk with a cane. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2006018599.CaseDesc: Richard Rees and Gregory Cook were last seen on July 17, 1998, leaving Sunnyside Beach, Nottawasaga Bay in Meaford, Ontario in a Schwill DS16 sailboat. The overturned sailboat was recovered, but Richard and Gregory have not been located.

Mark: Upper Back, pale birthmark on right side

Case reference: 2014001533.CaseDesc: On September 10, 1988, Alojz Bracek was on a hunting trip in the Tony Tower area near Fox Creek, Alberta, with two hunting partners and went missing when he was separated from them.

Case reference: 2014002689.CaseDesc: Karel Szabo was last heard from in April or May of 1985, when he sent his mother, who lived in Czechoslovakia, a postcard from Los Angeles, California. Karel had written about his travels to Las Vegas and San Francisco. In November 1984, Karel had informed his family that he was going to Barrie, Ontario, to get a trucking job; when in fact he travelled to the United States.

Scar: Waist, Dime sized surgical scar near the bellybutton.
Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Jaw, Lower right side jaw broken in 1982.

Case reference: 2006024399.CaseDesc: Mark Cornett was last seen at Missinaibi Lake, 1.0 kilometre north of Fairy Point in Missinaibi Township. He was involved in a boating accident on his way back from fishing and is presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 1996003690.CaseDesc: On August 29, 1994, Angela Arseneault was reported missing by her common law spouse. She was last seen on August 19, 1994, they and another male went shopping. Later that day, Angela left to catch a bus home alone. When her common law spouse returned home, the lights were on in the apartment, a window was left open and Angela’s purse was in the kitchen. Angela has not been seen since.

Tattoo: Left Ankle, rose and stem (6 inches long)

Case reference: 2014004201.CaseDesc: Rodney Hicks was last seen at his residence at 1700hrs on March 3, 1989. Mr. Hicks has an intellectual disability. He suffered from epilepsy and autism.

Case reference: 2014000005.CaseDesc: Kenneth Chester FEHR was last seen on November 27th, 2012 at approximately 5:30 PM in the 1700 block of Idylwyld Drive North, Saskatoon, SK. He left behind his wallet and cell phone. Prior to leaving he told numerous family and friends good bye. He also spoke of harming himself.

Hair: Blonde, Wavy, Dirty blonde wavy hair down past his shoulders
Pants: Cotton, Grey, Sweat pants. Work clothes stained with tar
Shirt: Cotton, Black, Work clothes stained with tar.  Could be grey in colour

Case reference: 2008005698.CaseDesc: Calvin Simms told a friend that he was tired of living on the street and was thinking about jumping off a bridge. Mr. Simms has not been heard from since.

Case reference: 2018027643.CaseDesc: On April 17, 2008, an unidentified man was discovered in Lake Ontario, near the Shoreview Place Beach in Stoney Creek, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts he was of Sub-Saharan African ancestry.

Case reference: 2015068386.CaseDesc: On April 12, 2015, the remains of a newborn baby boy were found on the grounds of the Free Church of Scotland in Mount Albion, Prince Edward Island.  The body was found wrapped in a towel with a green frog embroidered on it.

Case reference: 2005005699.CaseDesc: On June 22, 1991, the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Niagara River between Horseshoe Falls and the "Maid of the Mist" boat docks. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 113 lbs, however this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He had signs of having suffered an acute or chronic right lung infection. He is estimated to have been dead for several months. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this unidentified male is either of European ancestry, or South Asian ancestry, or mixed European and South Asian ancestry.

Teeth: Several amalgam fillings in his teeth and multiple posterior teeth in his upper and lower jaw were lost/removed prior to death.

Case reference: 2014005149.CaseDesc: On May 21, 2008, Zelalem Assefa was last seen visiting relatives in Calgary, Alberta. Zelalem is from Ethiopia and had only been in Canada for about a year and a half when he disappeared.

Case reference: 2014006024.CaseDesc: On March 10, 2013, Richard Bailey was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. He was reported missing by his wife the next day when he failed to return home from work.

Case reference: 2008007599.CaseDesc: On September 10, 1978, Hugh Bain and three others were participating in the Oshawa Clipper Race from Oshawa, Ontario to Olcott, New York and back to Oshawa. Mr. Bain took his turn to operate the 24 foot boat. A large wave hit the boat and broke over it. The movement of the boat and the wave breaking over the boat sent him over the port side into Lake Ontario.  Mr. Bain has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2010002299.CaseDesc: Susan Gourley was last seen in late November of 2001, by a friend, in the area of Barton Street and Stirton Avenue, in downtown Hamilton.  She was reported missing by her mother February 28th, 2002.

Case reference: 2008008498.CaseDesc: Helen Lipinski went to the Roman Court Bingo Hall with her daughter. She stepped out of the hall, leaving her purse behind. Mrs. Lipinski has a history of mental health issues. She previously mentioned wanting to visit her sister in Chihuahua, Mexico.

Jewelry: Gold, birthstone with 7 stones, 1 was missing

Case reference: 2017000313.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1999, the burned body of a male was found in a garage fire in downtown Edmonton. The individual may have had a slightly deformed nose from an old fracture.

Case reference: 2014002960.CaseDesc: David Wycotte was last seen by his family on November 1, 1975, in Williams Lake, British Columbia. Up until December 1975, David was working in Winfield, British Columbia as a berry picker. David has been known to travel the area and the United States looking for labour jobs.

Case reference: 2014004558.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1992, at approximately 9:00am, Rodolfo Morales was last heard from when he spoke to his friend over the telephone.

Case reference: 2017073558.CaseDesc: On June 18, 2016, an unidentified man was found at the “St. Basil-the-Great College School” in Toronto, Ontario. The man had previously identified himself as John Doe, and biogeographic ancestry testing predicts that he was of East Asian ancestry.

Foreign Object: Lower Back, Fragments of old bullet in lumbar
Scar: Left Thigh, Round scar on left lateral thigh
Left Buttocks, Puckered scar on left posterior thigh
Middle Back, Mid-back on the left side
Chest, Scar in the left and right axillas
Right Chest, Scar on right nipple

Case reference: 2016065655.CaseDesc:
On May 27, 1978, a female was found floating 1000 feet off the west shore of Fighting Island, Sandwich West Township in the Detroit River. 
Her post-mortem weight was recorded as being 155lbs, however, this measurement may not represent her actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. 
It is estimated that she had been in the water for a couple of days to a couple of weeks.

Teeth: Several amalgam restorations and is missing her upper left canine tooth
Blouse: Multi-coloured long-sleeved button front, floral & green square pattern "Lennington California"Brand
Socks: Cotton, Multi-coloured red and yellow elasticized cotton ankle socks
Other: Intrauterine device implanted in her uterus.

Case reference: 1994001630.CaseDesc: Amber Potts was last seen in her hometown of Etobicoke, Ontario when she was 16 years old. She has a history of running away, however she always kept in touch with family or friends. She had been staying in a hotel, but she left behind all her personal belongings and hasn't been seen since. Amber had substance abuse issues.

Case reference: 2016061106.CaseDesc: On November 1, 2006, the partial remains of a male were recovered from the Jordan Creek by a local resident who was dismantling a beaver dam on Old Hastings Road, in Centre Hastings, which is located North of Belleville, Ontario. The remains are believed to have been there at least 5 to 10 years and likely many more.

Case reference: 2014002008.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1999, Pierre Bédard was seen for the last time while he left his home in Levis, Quebec. Mr. Bédard’s vehicle was located at Anse Benson in the St- Romuald neighbourhood in Levis.

Case reference: 2013000015.CaseDesc: On November 6, 1968, Robert Lessard went onto the Ottawa River in a boat, travelling to a hunting camp. He never arrived and the boat was located on the river.

Case reference: 2012020078.CaseDesc: On June 2, 1990, Anthony Whitehead was last seen at a party on the Gordon's First Nation, SK. Searches and investigation over the years have failed to locate Mr. Whitehead.

Tattoo: Skull with hat on one arm, unknown which arm
Left Hand, Phyllis Bluecloud covered to look like a bar
Middle Back, Skull and dragon, others

Case reference: 2019040199.CaseDesc: In March 1966, the remains of a male believed to be between the ages of 50-60 were discovered by the CN Railway tracks in Chilliwack, British Columbia. The unidentified male had lost many of his teeth during life and had prominent eyebrows and a broken nose which was crooked to the right. It is believed he may have fallen or have been pushed from a moving train.

Teeth: Most of the teeth have been lost
Shoes: Black, Rubber soles, "Bilt-Rite Oil Proof", size 10, width E
Pants: Blue, With brown and white suspenders
Coat: Wool, Brown, Herringbone pattern, striped brown and light brown
Deformity: Nose, Nose crooked to the right due to an old injury

Case reference: 2016065831.CaseDesc: On October 12, 1977, the remains of a male, believed to be an adult, were found in the water off of Coney Island, Lake of the Woods, Kenora. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 200lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He was fully clothed, however, no description of clothing is available.  It is believed that he had been in the water for several weeks.

Case reference: 2014001217.CaseDesc: On August 6, 2011, the body of an adult male believed to be approximately 55 years old, was found near the "La Maison du Père" homeless shelter located in the Ville-Marie district in Montreal, Quebec. This person is unknown to this organization. The man had bypass surgery for arthosclerotic heart disease in the past.

Shoes: Grey, Blue, Sportek brand running shoes; size 9

Case reference: 2014005328.CaseDesc: In October 1986, Frances Neilson was observed by family leaving her residence in Edmonton, Alberta in the family vehicle. A few days later the vehicle was recovered but Frances has not been heard from since.

Case reference: 2014002267.CaseDesc: On April 11, 1992, Pawel Gazdzicki was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Pawel was despondent, suffered from mental health issues, and may have lost his memory. He had mentioned wanting to jump off of the Champlain Bridge.

Case reference: 2014004949.CaseDesc: On June 3, 1968, it was reported that George Knott had been missing since the previous day. He had been traveling by boat between St. Theresa and Garden Hill, Manitoba. George's boat and dog were located. All attempts to locate him failed and he remains missing.

Scar: Left Shin, 1 inch lateral scar across left shin - axe wound
Left Knee, 1.5 inch lateral scar across inside left knee - axe wound
Left Foot, 1.5 inch lateral scar across top left foot - axe wound
1 inch lateral scar inside of right or left foot - axe wound

Case reference: 2014002762.CaseDesc: On March 3rd, 1982, Laurence Peterson and Randolph Johanson were reported missing by Mr. Johanson’s girlfriend. Mr. Johanson and Mr. Peterson were last seen on February 28th, 1982, leaving the Shelter Island Marina, on their boats. Mr. Johanson was reportedly using his 26 ft. long salvage tug boat to haul Mr. Peterson’s 43 ft. wooden halibut fishing vessel to Lund, BC. The men were reported missing when they did not arrive at their destination. Extensive searches were unsuccessful. It has been speculated that the two men disappeared to start a new life.

Teeth: Other, Wide space in between the front teeth
Scar: Chest, 1 inch scar on left breast

Case reference: 2014004703.CaseDesc: On August 13, 1995, Marie-Josée Boisjoli left her home in Laval, QC, mentioning that she was going to an appointment without giving any further details. The next day, her vehicle and personal belongings were found at the family cottage, located in the Gélinas Lake area in Mont-Tremblant. She has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2006007599.CaseDesc: Leland Iseler was last seen October 9, 1967, at a hunt camp on the Mattagami River,  near Cypress Falls, 30 miles north of Smooth Rock Falls.  His boat was found anchored about 100 feet off shore and his fishing rod was missing. Leland Iseler has never been located.

Case reference: 2009005399.CaseDesc: Brian Henry was last seen in North Bay, Ontario on May 5, 1974, at approximately 3:00pm. On that day, his father drove him to Canadore College, so he could walk the nature trails.

Jacket: May have been wearing a green work jacket
May have been wearing a dark blue work jacket
Denim, Blue, "Coca Cola" logo on left pocket
Watch: Black, With a large black strap, glowed in the dark
Hat: Black, Cowboy or scout type hat

Case reference: 2014004910.CaseDesc: In 2002, Suppiah Dillirajah was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Prior to being reported missing, Suppiah had not been seen for five years.

Case reference: 2006000899.CaseDesc: On November 5, 1990, a male was found at the Bloor-Yonge Subway Station in Toronto. His post-mortem length was estimated to be 5’10", however, due to traumatic injury, the estimated length may not be an accurate representation of his actual living height. His personal effects included a TTC Pass Card, a "Maxell" cassette tape.

Shirt: Blue, long-sleeve shirt with vertical stripes
Sweater: Black, White, horizontal stripe knit sweater
Jacket: black and grey pinstripe suit jacket
Scar: Left Hand, small scars on back of hand
Neck, fine scars on both sides of the neck

Case reference: 2008003699.CaseDesc: Gary Anderson and his wife Dawn were camping and fishing on Kilburn Lake in Woodland Caribou Provincial Park.  Mr. Anderson went out fishing on the lake alone in his canoe and never returned. A search by land, water and air turned up only a fishing lure and a hat.

Case reference: 2014004872.CaseDesc: Andre Lemieux was last seen on January 9, 2007 in Montreal. He brought his child to daycare and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2016045557.CaseDesc: In January 2015, Warner Huckerby was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014003894.CaseDesc: Jean Gravel and Jean-Guy Champagne were employees of the Rio Bar in downtown Trois-Rivières. On July 6, 1972, they arrived at work in the early evening; they were to work there until closing. They never returned home and have not been seen since. They were reported missing on July 10, 1972.

Jewelry: Gold, ring on the left ring finger
Silver, wedding ring on the left ring finger

Case reference: 2014003073.CaseDesc: Michael Hammond was last seen on November 24, 1991 at his residence in Richmond, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2017031348.CaseDesc: On June 3, 2017, Mary Papatsie was reported missing. Ms. Papatsie was last seen in the afternoon of April 27, 2017, in the area of Montreal Road and Marier Street in Ottawa. Ms. Papatsie lived a high risk lifestyle. There has been no contact with family or friends since. Numerous sightings were reported to the police in the weeks following Ms. Papatsie’s disappearance, however, no one spoke directly to her. As a result these sightings are unconfirmed.

Scar: Left Eye, Due to a piercing

Case reference: 2006007499.CaseDesc: David Goetz and Lucas Zenger were last seen on August 23, 1992, in the Owen Sound area. They went for a canoe ride.  They travelled down the shoreline along Kepple Township, towards Big Bay. The canoe was located approximately 1.5 miles off Cape Commodore.

Case reference: 2014005890.CaseDesc: On February 15, 2012, Marie Antoinette Carlson was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. Marie has been known to travel to Calgary, Alberta and Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014004257.CaseDesc: On March 24, 2003, Paul David Garcia was reported missing by his family in Chilliwack, British Columbia. Mr. Garcia left home in March 1997 leaving his vehicle and personal effects behind.

Case reference: 2014005436.CaseDesc: On May 5, 2009, Mohamed Ibrahim was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005006.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2007, Sun Jin, her husband Joon Han, and their daughter Il Han were seen for the last time at a school in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005873.CaseDesc: On August 31, 2012, Mark Pearson left his residence in Coaticook, Quebec. Searches have led police to believe that Mr. Pearson could have possibly fallen in the Coaticook River near the intersection of Child and St. Paul East streets in Coaticook, Quebec. He was reported missing on September 7, 2012.

Sweater: Cotton, Blue, T-shirt with Puma on the front

Case reference: 2014005526.CaseDesc: Angela Meyer went missing from her parents’ residence. She was on a weekend pass from Stanton Territorial Hospital and under the legal guardianship of her mother. Miss Meyer had gone outside of the residence for a cigarette and has not been seen since. There were sightings of her walking in the Con Mine area.  She was taking various medications and did not take the medications with her when she went missing.

Jacket: Nylon, Red, Black, Hip length, black on the back of sleeves

Case reference: 2009247848.CaseDesc: Christopher and Alexander are missing from the York region but were located in Poland where they are residing with their non-custodial mother.

Case reference: 2012020164.CaseDesc: These remains were located on the South West Marine Drive off-ramp below the north end of the Arthur Laing Bridge.

Case reference: 2019054192.CaseDesc: Danick Bourgeois was seen for the last time during the month of July 2019. He has been known to reside in a homemade trailer in St. Bernadin, Ontario and in a tent near Hawkesbury, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001837.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1979 at approximately 8:30 a.m. seven men departed from Anama Bay, Manitoba on a fishing trip. The men departed as a group in three separate boats and were heading for Warpath. At approximately 7:30 p.m. that same day, the occupants of the first boat reported to the RCMP that the other two boats were missing. They described the waves as being three to four feet high and they could not see the tree line from where they were. They lost sight of the other two boats and fired shotgun shots into the air hoping for a response. No response was received. Extensive patrols by air, boat and land were made in an attempt to locate the remaining five men. The bodies of Fredrick Ursu and Jerry Hudy were never recovered. Mr. Ursu and Mr. Hudy are presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014004451.CaseDesc: On February 22, 1964, Marie Mike was seen for the last time leaving a residence on the Beardy's/Okemasis First Nation Reserve near Rosthern, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2012020058.CaseDesc: Roger Keesick has been missing since May of 1986.  He is very handy with woodworking and renovating.  He is also known to associate with a lot of street people.  Mr. Keesick last told his family that he was going to work at a fishing lodge outside of Winnipeg.  It was later discovered that he had never made it there.

Scar: Report only indicates "body scars"; no location indicated

Case reference: 2014005330.CaseDesc: On September 13, 2009, at approximately 6:30 a.m., Rose Mackinnon was seen for the last time when she left the Earnestine Women’s shelter with her two children. Rose advised that she would be returning but has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014001853.CaseDesc: On May 19, 1958, Clifford McKell and a friend were last seen having supper and told friends they were going out in the canoe. Neither of the men were considered experienced paddlers. No one witnessed the men leaving in the canoe. The following day they were reported missing by their employer when they failed to report to work. Police commenced an investigation and an air search found the overturned canoe. Paddles and safety cushions were also located. A witness who saw two men in a canoe around 8:30 pm indicated they were headed in a southerly direction and the lake was quite rough at the time. It is presumed Mr. McKell drowned.

Case reference: 2006008599.CaseDesc: Adrien McNaughton wandered off into a wooded area of Holmes Lake, Brougham Township, on June 12, 1972.

Scar: Forehead, approximately 1 - 2 inches long, and possibly over the left eye.

Case reference: 2014005313.CaseDesc: On September 24, 2007, Azelea Brown last spoke to her mother who was overseas.

Case reference: 2014001154.CaseDesc: On May 1st, 1974, the remains of an adult male were found near the East Saanich Reserve in British Columbia. He was approximately 60-75 years old, wore dentures and it is believed that he would have gone missing more than ten years before. A silver Eversharp pencil from the 1920’s engraved with the initials “MC” was found near the body.

Boots: Leather, Black, Ankle boot, size 8 or 9

Case reference: 2021003909.CaseDesc: On April 6, 2018, Rita Squalli and Maria Squalli were last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Rita and Maria were taken by their father under false pretences, and it is believed that the girls are being kept overseas.

Case reference: 2010003699.CaseDesc: During the evening of Friday, May 31, 1974, 7 year old Cheryl Hanson left her home on Bloomington Road for a 10 minute walk to her cousin’s house, also located on Bloomington Road. She never arrived.  No trace of Cheryl or any of her belongings has ever been found.

Other: Paper bag with white pajamas with floral design

Case reference: 2012020041.CaseDesc: Carolyn Pruyser was last seen at a Mohawk service station in Peace River shortly after midnight on May 17, 1984.  Her car was found abandoned a short distance from her parents home with keys and purse still in the car.

Blouse: Yellow, Orange, Short Sleeve "V" Neck Blouse

Case reference: 2016059266.CaseDesc:
On March 29th, 2008, the body of a male was found under a subway bridge at Bloor and Parliament Streets, Toronto, where he apparently slept often. A beige jacket, black nylon pants, a dark blue knit hat and tan ankle shoes with tan laces were located in close proximity to his body.  He was uncircumcised and his appendix is absent.
He is believed to be a homeless individual and was found by another homeless man who referred to him as "Pops" and "Joe".

Hair: Brown, Grey, Wavy, Short, Beard & moustache, slightly greying & yellow
Teeth: Visible Missing, Many of his teeth were lost prior to his death and the remaining teeth are decayed. There is no dental work.
Underwear: Dark Blue, White, Dark blue/black and white striped boxers
Pants: Checkered black and blue flannel pants
Deformity: Valgus deformity of both large toes
Fractured/Broken Bones: Pelvis, Healed fracture, left Ilio-pubic ramus
Scar: 1.5 cm in length, inner right knee
Right Abdomen, 16 cm scar with suture marks
a 6 cm scar on his right lower abdomen

Case reference: 2006018799.CaseDesc: Michael Recollet was last seen on August 20, 1991 at Okeechobee Lodge Dock, in Fraser Point. He was  heading in a westerly direction towards Birch Island by boat. His 16 foot cedar strip boat and 25HP Mariner motor were recovered near Mary's Point, Little La Cloche Island.

Case reference: 2014003900.CaseDesc: On December 8, 1977 at approximately 3 p.m., Ronald Foucault left his father’s business located in the city of Blainville, Quebec and told his father he had to travel to Texas, in the United States for work. There has been no news from Ronald since this time and it is impossible to confirm his arrival in the United States. In 1979, some of his belongings were found near the Dorval airport in Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014005999.CaseDesc: On February 5, 2013, at approximately 3:00 p.m., Quincy Blackburn was seen for the last time when his sister dropped him off at the Toronto Person International Airport in Toronto, Ontario. Quincy boarded a flight to Trinidad and was scheduled to return on February 19, but did not board the flight.

Pants: Red, White, TRACK, Track pants; Brand: Adidas
Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Earrings, Square diamond earrings

Case reference: 2014005045.CaseDesc: William MORGAN was last seen during the early morning hours of October 28, 1968, at a cabin near Moose Mountain Provincial Park, approximately 12km north of Arcola, SK. At the time of his disappearance, Mr. MORGAN was planning to go out hunting in the area for deer. He had no vehicle and had a slow deliberate walk. A 30-30 rifle was also found to be missing from the cabin. Searches of the area have failed to locate any sign of Mr. MORGAN.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, blue flag and eagle

Case reference: 2021002686.CaseDesc: On January 12, 2021, shortly after 5:00 pm, Brock Curtis was last seen at the Prospect Point in Niagara Falls State Park, New York. Several witnesses observed Brock jumping into the falls, and being swept away.

Case reference: 2016068940.CaseDesc: On December 8, 2016, Cory Lanteigne was reported missing by family members after having gone out for a short walk, and never returning. He was not dressed for the weather conditions at the time and was experiencing a mental health crisis. An extensive ground search was conducted by police in the area where he was last seen but failed to locate him.

Case reference: 2016064577.CaseDesc: On December 9, 1982, the remains of an adult male were discovered outside of a burning shed at 348 Front Street West, with burns to the body. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 139lbs and his length was measured between 5'4" and 5'9", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.  His appendix was present. It is likely that he was an alcoholic.

Deformity: Torso (Back), Spine was curved to the side and the front; this may have been noticeable

Case reference: 2015017945.CaseDesc: On August 29, 1995, fishermen saw a man's body in the waters of the Prairie River near Gagné Island. According to experts the approximate time of death would be from a few days to a week.

Shoes: Black, only one shoe found; size 10EEE

Case reference: 2007005499.CaseDesc: Lindsey Nicholls was 14 years old when she disappeared in 1993. She left the group home where she was living in the Comox Valley, BC at about 10:30 a.m. after having an argument with her foster mother. She was last seen walking away from the residence to visit some friends in Courtenay. She left all of her belongings and treasures in her room; she did not seem to be planning to run away.

Case reference: 2014001757.CaseDesc: On January 12, 1987, Patricia Hutton was seen for the last time in the Saint-Léonard district of Montreal, Quebec. She had an appointment at a daycare center on the corner of Beaubien and Langelier for a job, but never attended. Patricia hasn’t been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2019051624.CaseDesc: On September 5, 2019, Michael Samdas was last seen on Yonge Street in Toronto, Ontario. Michael has connections in several cities in Ontario, such as Hamilton, Sudbury, North Bay, Brantford, Toronto and Niagara.

Hair: Brown, Curly, Other, Dark, medium length hair with highlights on tips

Case reference: 2014006178.CaseDesc: An investigation revealed that nobody had seen or heard from Alex Klym since the mid 1970's. The family had made attempts to locate Alex, but they were unsuccessful and nobody ever reported that he was missing. Inquiries were made with various government agencies in an attempt to find some evidence of him after the mid 1970's. There is no trace of him. The body of Alex Klym has never been recovered. It is not known what happened to Alex, but foul play cannot be ruled out.

Case reference: 2014005302.CaseDesc: On November 11, 2005, in Toronto, Canada, Zaina Trujillo-Talib was abducted by her father, Chaudhry Talib and her paternal grandmother, Shama Talib.  Chaudhry and Shama immediately took six-year-old Zaina to their family home located in Lahore, Pakistan.  Since this time, Zaina's mother has not been allowed to have any contact with her daughter.

Case reference: 2014004580.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 23rd of July 1991, a group of 8 individuals left Igloolik NU. heading to Hall Beach, NU.  The group travelled using a 24 feet freighter canoe powered by a 30 hp outboard.  It was a stormy day with heavy rain.  Approximately 15 miles North of Hall Beach, the canoe hit ice, filled with water and capsized.  Only one occupant made it back to shore.

Case reference: 2006027999.CaseDesc: On August 15, 1986 Clayton Duncan McFaul was last seen by a family member on the family farm near Havelock Ontario. Mr. McFaul was completing his usual daily farm chores. He was very punctual about meal times, so when he failed to arrive for his lunch his family were concerned. An extensive search failed to locate Mr. McFaul.  Several possible sightings were reported after August 15, 1986, but none led to Mr. McFaul's location.

Hair: Bald, White, Other, Bald with fringe

Case reference: 2014002368.CaseDesc: On June 11th, 1969, at approximately 5:50 PM, the Happy Valley-Goose Bay RCMP received a report of an empty boat drifting in Lake Melville, in the vicinity of North West Point, North West River, NL.  Police attended and learned that this empty boat belonged to Lawrence Alton Oliver, who had been reported to have departed his residence earlier in the morning to go seal hunting.  It is believed that Mr. Oliver fell overboard while hunting and drowned.  The body of Mr. Oliver has never been located.

Boots: Rubber, Brown, Red, Rubber hip waders with a red band

Case reference: 2022009358.CaseDesc: On March 17, 2005, shortly after midnight, Patricia Bessel was last seen leaving her residence in Grand Island, New York. Patricia’s vehicle was subsequently located in a parking lot near the American Falls in Niagara Falls, New York. At the time of her disappearance, Patricia was despondent
